moves.1. e4: Another one of my fast losses, with a beautiful mate ending. This is another case of "Better castle in time!"
moves.1... d6 2. d4 Nf6 3. Nc3 g6 4. Bg5 Bg7 5: This does not seem necessary, only weakens the black king side's light squares.
moves.7. Bg3 Nh5: Then, to chase this bishop instead of developing my pieces was not the right strategy.
moves.8. O-O-O Nd7 9. Nge2 c5 10. dxc5 Nxc5 11: Now he goes for my king.
moves.11... g4 12. Bh2 Qb6 13. Nd4 Ne6:
?
This move neglects the weakness of the light squares in black's camp.
13...Bd7 and 14...0-0-0 was the necessary thing to do.
moves.14. Nf5 Nc7 15. Nxg7+: Black loses his well placed black bishop.
moves.15... Nxg7: A knight on g7... how awkward!
moves.16. e5:
!
The lines are going to open up and it is too late for black to do anything about it.
moves.16... Bf5 17. exd6 Rd8 18. Qe1: The bishop on h2 controls the square d6 and the e7-pawn is pinned against the black king. The black position is pathetic.
moves.18... Nce6: Tries to block the e-file, but the white attack is rolling.
moves.19. Bb5+ Kf8 20. Nd5:
!
Gives the bishop for the final hit.
